body_html:
It appears that the inputs vector has a single element while input_values has two elements. TF_SessionRun requires that inputs and input_values be the same size (providing one concrete TF_Tensor for each input node in the graph).

So I suspect the segmentation fault you're getting is when TF_SessionRun tries to access inputs[1].

Hope that helps.
Feel free to reopen if I'm mistaken.
Thanks.

It appears that the inputs vector has a single element while input_values has two elements. TF_SessionRun requires that inputs and input_values be the same size (providing one concrete TF_Tensor for each input node in the graph).
So I suspect the segmentation fault you're getting is when TF_SessionRun tries to access inputs[1].
Hope that helps.

Thanks.
body:
It appears that the `inputs` vector has a single element while `input_values` has two elements. `TF_SessionRun` requires that `inputs` and `input_values` be the same size (providing one concrete `TF_Tensor` for each input node in the graph).

So I suspect the segmentation fault you're getting is when `TF_SessionRun` tries to access `inputs[1]`.

Hope that helps.
Feel free to reopen if I'm mistaken.
Thanks.
